intro: Orthosiphon nyasicus, commonly known as African mint or wild mint, is a herbaceous plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Lamiaceae family, which is characterized by square stems and aromatic leaves. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and has opposite, ovate leaves with a slightly hairy surface. Its small, pale blue or violet flowers are arranged in whorled clusters, and it produces small, oblong fruits that contain seeds. Orthosiphon nyasicus is often used in traditional medicine for its purported diuretic and anti-inflammatory properties.
